page.title: 06THE HERITAGE COAST
page.content:
WEST WIGHT
Mr Edney the Heritage Coast officer has a job of looking after the countryside. He picks up litter that is lying around and he clears up streams. Mr Edney protects animals, plants and birds. He contacts police to collect canisters of poison and works with farmers. He helps visitors by tidying up and he gets money from the government because tourists help the economy of the Isle of Wight. He cuts new paths and puts fences at the Needles view point and conducts heritage walks.
